subject: Nutrition
title: Can Vitamin C Cure a Cold
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Can Vitamin C Cure a Cold.

hook.text: Every winter, people load up on vitamin C at the first sniffle. Does it actually work?

buildup.text: Dozens of clinical trials have tested whether vitamin C prevents or shortens the common cold.

discovery.text: Regular supplementation reduces cold duration by about 8% in adultsâ€”roughly half a day less.

twist.text: Taking vitamin C after symptoms start shows almost no benefit. Timing mattersâ€”start before the cold.

climax.text: A few servings of fruit daily provides all the vitamin C most immune systems need.

punchline.text: Half a day shorter. That's the honest answer.

quiz.question: When must you take vitamin C for it to help with colds?
